The scenes depicting Watney's isolation in the vast, dusty Martian landscape in the movie adaptation of Weir's novel are magnificently represented by exteriors shot in the vicinity of Wadi Rum in Jordan. Scott expected to film Watney as a Robinson Crusoe, a character in full isolation, but learned to film Watney differently since the character would be self-monitoring his behavior under the watch of various mission cameras.

The scenes back on Earth provide a hectic, densely populated counterweight to the Martian aridity depicted in the movie adaptation of Weir's novel. Todd McCarthy of The Hollywood Reporter wrote that these scenes offer a contrasting view to the barren and dry planet where Watney is stranded.
